titlestmt.titleproper: Lists of Paris Mint medal collection and other works of art, circa 1900
titlestmt.author: David Hill

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid Description by Archives Arnold Tescher. Edited and encoded by David Hill using EADitor ©2014

change.item: Imported into EADitor. Some normalization has occurred to apply EAD 2002 schema validation and conform to EADitor basic requirements.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Lists of Paris Mint medal collection and other works of art
did.abstract: Lists of French art medals and other works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Handwritten and typewritten lists describing French art medals from the Paris Mint by such medalists as Roty, Dubois, Chaplain, Bory, Chapu and others. Also, a list of Gorham Company collection of plaster bas reliefs depicting notable French statesmen, writers, royalty, scientists, etc. Also included are typewritten lists of plaster bas-reliefs of famous persons and their birth and death dates from other countries, including Germany, Holland, and Greece. Lists appear to have been compiled circa late 19th or early 20th century. Also in the folder is a page describing lots 223-228 of property from the corporate collection of Lenox/Gorham in the Christie’s 2006 auction of 19th century furniture, sculpture, works of art, and ceramics.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lists of Paris Mint medal collection and other works of art, Archives, American Numismatic Society.

userestrict.head: Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright restrictions may apply. Permission to publish or reproduce must be secured from the American Numismatic Society.
